required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nicardipine and Labetalol Effects on Cerebral Hemodynamics in Preeclampsia
clinical_study.official_title: How Nicardipine and Labetalol Affect Cerebral Hemodynamics in Severe Preeclamptic Patients: A Pilot Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: Realization of transcranial doppler and optic nerve sheath in severe preeclamptic patients to evaluate the impact of nicardipine and labetalol on cerebral hemodynamics.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of values obtained by ultrasonography optic nerve sheath measurement from baseline to 2 hours post starting infusion of nicardipine or labetalol.
primary_outcome.time_frame: just before treatment and 2 hours after
primary_outcome.description: Variation of values will be studied during a 2 hour time period, starting just before administration of either labetalol or nicardipine by i.v. route

secondary_outcome.measure: variation of diastolic and systolic velocities in middle cerebral artery before and after administration of either labetalol or nicardipine by i.v. route
secondary_outcome.time_frame: just before treatment and at 30 minutes to 60 minutes, 2 hours to 3 hours and 6 hours to 8 hours
secondary_outcome.description: values are obtained by transcranial doppler

secondary_outcome.measure: variation of PI in middle cerebral artery before and after administration of either labetalol or nicardipine by i.v. route
secondary_outcome.time_frame: just before treatment and at 30 minutes to 60 minutes, 2 hours to 3 hours and 6 hours to 8 hours
secondary_outcome.description: values are obtained by transcranial doppler

secondary_outcome.measure: proportion of pathologic PI in middle cerebral artery in each group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: just before treatment and at 30 minutes to 60 minutes, 2 hours to 3 hours and 6 hours to 8 hours
secondary_outcome.description: values are obtained by transcranial doppler

secondary_outcome.measure: proportion of optic nerve sheath up to 5.8 mm in each group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: just before treatment and at 30 minutes to 60 minutes, 2 hours to 3 hours and 6 hours to 8 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: values of optic nerve sheath diameter in each group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 30 minutes to 60 minutes and 6 hours to 8 hours

arm_group.description: Patients who will receive labetalol in IV route in first intention
Patients who will receive nicardipine in IV route in first intention

intervention.intervention_name: optic nerve sheath measurement and transcranial doppler
intervention.description: evaluation of cerebral hemodynamics through measurement of systolic and diastolic velocities and PI in middle cerebral artery. Intracranial pressure will be appreciate by optic nerve sheath value

study_pop.textblock: women with severe preeclampsia and antihypertensive drug administrated by i.v. route

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged up to 18 years
- patient with severe preeclampsia defined by Systolic blood pressure ≥ 140 mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure ≥ 90 mmHg after 20 weeks of amenorrhea, associated with neurologic troubles, eclampsia of epigastric pain.
- Decision by clinician to introduce an antihypertensive therapy by oral route : either labetalol or nicardipine
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of intracranial expansive processus, surgery or vascular disease
- infectious state on probe placement
- unilateral anophthalmia
